definition: to pour out (emotions)/to unburden oneself (of strong feelings)/to vomit comprehensively
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to vomit/to throw up
to pour out one's heart
to pour out (emotions)/to pour one's heart out/to say everything that is on one's mind

sentences.english: The act of vocally expressing our troubles to a trusted friend can offer instant stress-reduction.
sentences.chinese: 和值得信赖的朋友倾吐自己的烦恼可以减轻压力。

sentences.english: She confided her troubles to a friend.
sentences.chinese: 她向朋友倾吐了内心的烦恼。

sentences.english: He confided his innermost secrets to her.
sentences.chinese: 他向她倾吐了内心深处的秘密。

sentences.english: The mouth of the virtuous utters wisdom and his tongue speaks of what is right.
sentences.chinese: 义人的口倾吐智慧，他的舌头讲论公义。

sentences.english: She poured out her worries to the doctor.
sentences.chinese: 她向医生倾吐出自己的忧愁。

sentences.english: Jone felt she could only confide in her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼觉得她只有向她妈妈倾吐心中的秘密。

sentences.english: He breathed words of love into her ear.
sentences.chinese: 他轻声在她耳畔倾吐爱恋之言。

sentences.english: I'd only met him once, and here he was, pouring out his heart to me。
sentences.chinese: 我只跟他见过一次面，但他已经在向我倾吐心事了。

sentences.english: I unloaded all my troubles on him.
sentences.chinese: 我向他倾吐我的种种烦恼。

sentences.english: She confided all her secrets to her best friend.
sentences.chinese: 她向她最好的朋友倾吐了所有的秘密。

sentences.english: To Jo alone did the shy girl tell her thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 这个羞怯的小姑娘只背对裘一个人倾吐自己的心曲。

sentences.english: So put your pen to paper and pour your feelings out for the love of your life.
sentences.chinese: 所以，拿起笔，倾吐你对至爱的情意吧。

sentences.english: Sure, you can unload your problems on your Pisces friend.
sentences.chinese: 当然，你可以对你的双鱼座朋友倾吐你的烦恼。

definition: to say everything (that is on one's mind)
to pour forth (one's opinions)
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to tell/to disclose/to reveal
to get sth off one's chest
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
to drain (by leading off water)/to unburden oneself/to divulge/to leak a secret
to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to pour out (emotions)/to pour one's heart out/to say everything that is on one's mind
to confide in each other (idiom)
(to express one's) true feelings/what is on one's mind/secret mind
pent-up frustrations/sth that has accumulated in one's mind for a long time
to have bitter digestive fluids rising to the mouth/fig. to complain bitterly/to pour out one's sufferings
depressed/dejected/feeling low
to have a heart-to-heart chat
